Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last meeting?
Hey, I’ve been okay. I did some research on training programs.
That’s fantastic! What did you find?
I found a couple of management courses that look interesting. They’re online, so I can do them at my own pace.
That sounds like a flexible option. How do you feel about starting one of those courses?
I feel good about it. I think it’ll help me feel more confident at work.
Confidence can make a big difference. Have you had any opportunities to apply what you learned in our last session regarding anger management?
Yeah, actually. I had another situation at work where I felt annoyed, but I tried to reframe my thoughts.
How did that go for you?
It went pretty well! I was able to let it go instead of getting worked up.
That’s amazing! It shows you’re making real progress. What did you tell yourself in that moment?
I thought about how my coworker might be stressed, and it helped me not take it personally.
That’s a great insight! It sounds like you’re developing a more compassionate perspective. Have you noticed any changes in your mood swings since we last spoke?
They’ve been a bit better. I’m still having them, but they’re not as intense.
That’s a positive step! It’s important to celebrate those small victories. Is there anything specific that has helped you manage those mood swings?
I’ve been trying to keep a journal to track my feelings. It helps me see patterns.
Journaling can be a powerful tool for self-reflection. What have you learned from it so far?
I noticed that my mood swings often happen when I’m stressed about work or personal stuff.
That’s a valuable insight. Recognizing the triggers is the first step in managing them. Would you like to explore stress management techniques?
Yes, please! I think that would be helpful.
One technique we can try is mindfulness meditation. It can help you stay present and reduce stress. Would you be open to trying that?
Yeah, I’d like to give it a shot.
Great! I can guide you through a simple exercise. We can practice it together now if you’d like.
Sure, let’s do it!
Okay, let’s start by finding a comfortable seated position. Close your eyes and take a deep breath in… and out. Focus on your breath. Inhale… and exhale.
How do you feel after that exercise?
I feel a bit more relaxed, actually. That was nice.
I’m glad to hear that! Mindfulness can be a great tool for managing stress and emotions. Would you like to incorporate that into your daily routine?
Yes, I think I’ll try to do it every morning.
That sounds like a wonderful plan. Let’s check in on that next time. Is there anything else you’d like to address today?
No, I think we covered a lot. Thanks, Ellie!
Thank you for being open and sharing. I’m looking forward to hearing about your progress next time!
Me too! See you later!
